moves.4... Bg7 5. Bd3: Book says Nf3 then Be3 but I forgot that but I can still transpose back
moves.5... c5: !? I had never seen this before
moves.7... Qc7 8. Qd2: Preparing f5 and then Bh6 trading of the Black DSB and weakening the black k-side
moves.9. Nd5 Qd6: Not the horrible Qc6 which falls to Bb5 pinning the Queen
moves.10. O-O-O: I castle to double up on the d-file
moves.10... O-O: I saw 12. e5 a couple of moves ago but needed to get it into a good position
moves.11. Bc4 Rd8: I think he was thinking of protecting his queen from a discovered attack but I had other plans
moves.12. e5: !(!) I have the second exclamation in brackets because some may disagree
moves.12... Qd7: Not: Qc7 loses the queen, Qc6 forked by Nxe7+, Qb6 and Qa6 loses the queen, Qe6 follows the same line as the game and Qf6 loses the queen
moves.13. Nxe7+ Qxe7 14. Qxd8+ Bf8: Not Qxd8 because Rxd8+ then Bf8 Rxc8 wins material
moves.15. Qxe7 Bxe7 16. Bxc5: I played this before thinking through whether or not it was sound
moves.16... Bxc5 17. Rd8+ Kg7: ? Better was Bf8 because I have to play Nh3 and he can then develop his LSB and protect it
moves.18. Rxc8: I don't care about Nf2 because I still get the bishop
moves.18... Be3+ 19. Kd1: I used to think Kb1 was better but if Nf2 then Ke2 I only lose the exchange
moves.19... Bxf4: ? Better was Nf2+ forking the King and rook
moves.20. Nh3: I want to protect the fork
moves.20... Bxe5 21. Re1: Wanting to plan Re7 attacking the the f-pawn and then I also get the b-pawn as well
moves.21... Bxh2 22. Re7 Ne5 23. Bd5: Threatening to capture the b-pawn and win the rook
moves.25. Bxb7 Ne7c6 26. Ng5: Threatening Nf3 and if Bg3 then Nxe5 Nxe5(Bxe5 drops the c6 knight) winning the a-pawn
moves.30... h5 31. c4: I start my own pawn advance
moves.31... h4 32. f4 Nd3 33. Ke2: Should I have played Rg8 + threatening Rh8# if Kh6
moves.33... Nxf4+ 34. Kf1 Bd4 35. Re4: I fork the Bishop and knight
moves.38... g4 39. Re3: ?? This is the blunder that costs me
moves.40. Kh2: I lok to remove the threat of queening but I am now lost
I might as well keep on pushing my pawns
moves.44. d6 Ke6 45. d7 Kxd7: I kept on pushing looking for a stalemate
moves.46. Kxg4 h2 47. Kf5 Bd4 48. a5 h1=Q: I hope I can stale mate
moves.49. b6 axb6 50. a6 b5 51. a7 Bxa7 52. Kx: I resign here. All comments welcome
